example_1: pāṇimhi ce vaṇo n'āssa, hareyya pāṇinā visaṃ, n'ābbaṇaṃ visam'anveti, n'atthi pāpaṃ akubbato.
example_2: pubb'āsave hitvā nave akubbaṃ, na chandagū no'pi nivissavādī, sa vippamutto diṭṭhigatehi dhīro, na lippati loke anattagarahī.
example_3: okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni, kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno, kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.

example_1: paṇītaṃ yadi vā lūkhaṃ, appaṃ vā yadi vā bahuṃ. yāpan'atthaṃ abhuñjiṃsu, agiddhā n'ādhimucchitā.
example_2: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

example_1: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sakuṇagghi lāpaṃ sakuṇaṃ sahasā ajjhappattā aggahesi.
example_2: saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā, paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā, saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ, te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.

example_1: idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.
example_2: ajjhattarūpe moceti, bahiddhārūpe moceti, ajjhattabahiddhārūpe moceti, ākāse kaṭiṃ kampento moceti, rāg'ūpatthambhe moceti, vacc'ūpatthambhe moceti, passāv'ūpatthambhe moceti, vāt'ūpatthambhe moceti, uccāliṅgapāṇakadaṭṭh'ūpatthambhe moceti

meaning: without knowing; without understanding; without insight
example_1: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.
na tena hoti dhammaṭṭho, yena-atthaṃ sāhasā naye, yo ca atthaṃ anatthañ'ca, ubho niccheyya paṇḍito.
example_2: tassa evaṃ hoti, sace maṃ koci kiñci vakkhati, ime me rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇissantī'ti.
example_3: evaṃ imassa bhoto purisapuggalassa ubhaya-attha kaliggaho
example_4: vinicchayā yāni pakappitāni, te ve munī brūsi anuggahāya, ajjhattasantī'ti yam'etam'atthaṃ, kathaṃ nu dhīrehi paveditaṃ taṃ.

example_1: idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.
na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

meaning: not leaning (on); not depending (on); being independent (of)
example_1: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

meaning: not grasping; not embracing; not taking up
example_1: sīlabbataṃ vā'pi pahāya sabbaṃ, kammañ'ca sāvajj'anavajjam'etaṃ, suddhiṃ asuddhin'ti apatthayāno, virato care santim'anuggahāya.
example_2: idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.

example_1: diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno, samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā, ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ, tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.
na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.

meaning: not smeared (by); not sullied (by); untainted (by); unstained (by)
example_1: sabb'ābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ, sabbesu dhammesu anūpalittaṃ, sabbañ'jahaṃ taṇhākkhaye vimuttaṃ, tam'ahaṃ naraṃ ekavihārī'ti brūmī'ti.
example_2: na brāhmaṇo aññato suddhim'āha, diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā, puññe ca pāpe ca anūpalitto, attañ'jaho na'y'idha pakubbamāno.
example_3: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

example_1: okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni, kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno, kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.

meaning: without religious practice; without ritual observances; not keeping vows
example_1: na muṇḍakena samaṇo, abbato alikaṃ bhaṇaṃ. icchālobhasamāpanno, samaṇo kiṃ bhavissati.
example_2: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

example_1: nāḷāgiriṃ gajavaraṃ atimattabhūtaṃ, dāv'aggicakkam'asanī'va, sudāruṇan'taṃ, metta-ambusekavidhinā jitavā mun'indo.
example_2: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

meaning: born in water; living in water; aquatic
example_1: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jal'ambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

meaning: name of one of the three daughters of Death
example_1: atha kho taṇhā ca arati ca ragā ca māradhītaro yena māro pāpimā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu.
example_2: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

example_1: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

samo visesī uda vā nihīno, yo maññatī so vivadetha tena, tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno, samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.

meaning: would wish (to); would desire (to); would want (to)
example_1: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.
example_2: na attahetu na parassa hetu, na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ, na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano, sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.

example_1: diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno, samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā, ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ, tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.
bāhuṃ sahassam'abhinimmita sāvudhan'taṃ, grīmekhalaṃ uditaghorasasenamāraṃ, dān'ādidhammavidhinā jitavā muna-indo, tan'tejasā bhavatu te jayamaṅgalāni
example_2: addasā kho, bhikkhave, vepacitti asur'indo sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ. disvāna sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ etadavoca, tikiccha maṃ devānam'indā'ti
example_3: etādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi, nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ, diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ, bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.
example_4: atha kho sakko devānam'indo yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

meaning: taking up; grasping; embracing; holding (onto); taking a stand (on)
example_1: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.
example_2: ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti, idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti, te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi, vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.

example_1: sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.
example_2: n'eva pubbenivāsāya, na'pi dibbassa cakkhuno, cetopariyāya iddhiyā, cutiyā upapattiyā, sotadhātuvisuddhiyā, paṇidhī me na vijjati.
example_3: etādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi, nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ, diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ, bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

example_1: na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti, na candanaṃ tagaramallikā, satañ'ca gandho paṭivātam'eti, sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.
example_2: ete ca ñatvā upanissitā'ti, ñatvā munī nissaye so vimaṃsī, ñatvā vimutto na vivādam'eti, bhavābhavāya na sameti dhīro'ti.
example_3: na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.

example_1: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.
okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni, kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno, kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.
example_2: yutto kathāyaṃ parisāya majjhe, pasaṃsam'icchaṃ vinighāti hoti, apāhatasmiṃ pana maṅku hoti, nindāya so kuppati randhamesī.

example_1: atthi imasmiṃ kāye… antaṃ antaguṇaṃ udariyaṃ karīsaṃ pittaṃ semhaṃ pubbo lohitaṃ sedo medo assu vasā kheḷo siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttaṃ matthaluṅgan'ti
example_2: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

meaning: (objects of) pleasure; sensual pleasure; sexual pleasure
example_1: satto guhāyaṃ bahun'ābhichanno, tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho, dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so, kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.
disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

meaning: of what kind?; how is it?; what is it like?
example_1: yasmiṃ kāmā na vasanti, taṇhā yassa na vijjati, kathaṃkathā ca yo tiṇṇo, vimokkho tassa kīdiso.
example_2: kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, kāḷako kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko, seyyathā'pi jhāmakhāṇū'ti.
example_3: etādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi, nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ, diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ, bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

example_1: okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni, kāmehi ritto apurakkharāno, kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā'ti.
taṃ vā'pi ganthaṃ kusalā vadanti, yaṃ nissito passati hīnam'aññaṃ, tasmā hi diṭṭhaṃ va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā, sīlabbataṃ bhikkhu na nissayeyya.
example_2: saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā, paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā, saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ, te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.
example_3: gat'addhino visokassa, vippamuttassa sabbadhi, sabbaganthappahīnassa, pariḷāho na vijjati.
example_4: tasmā piyaṃ na kayirātha, piy'āpāyo hi pāpako, ganthā tesaṃ na vijjanti, yesaṃ n'atthi piy'āppiya.

meaning: who is skilled in; who is fulfilled in; who is complete in
example_1: na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.

meaning: could desire; would long (for); could yearn (for)
example_1: patthayamānassa hi jappitāni, pavedhitaṃ vā'pi pakappitesu, cut'ūpapāto idha yassa n'atthi, sa kena vedheyya kuhiṃ'va jappe.
example_2: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

example_1: bhummā c'āyantu devā jalathalavisame yakkhagandhabbanāgā tiṭṭhantā santike, yaṃ munivaravacanaṃ sādhavo me suṇantu
example_2: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jala-ambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

example_1: atha kho taṇhā ca arati ca ragā ca māradhītaro yena māro pāpimā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu.

meaning: name of one of the three daughters of Death
example_1: atha kho taṇhā ca arati ca ragā ca māradhītaro yena māro pāpimā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu.
example_2: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

example_1: na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.
example_2: byākaramāno, bhikkhave, tathāgato evaṃ byākareyya, ye vodātā cakkhusotaviññeyyā dhammā, saṃvijjanti te tathāgatassa, etaṃpatho'ham'asmi, etaṃgocaro, no ca tena tammayo'ti.

example_1: samo visesī uda vā nihīno, yo maññatī so vivadetha tena, tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno, samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.
example_2: ayaṃ varāko kiñ'cā'pi idāni sukhito susajjito bhoge paribhuñjati, atha kho tīsu dvāresu ekenā'pi katassa kalyāṇakammassa abhāvā idāni apāyesu anappakaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedissatī'ti.
example_3: phasse āhāre pariññāte tisso vedanā pariññātā honti. tīsu vedanāsu pariññātāsu ariyasāvakassa n'atthi kiñci uttarikaraṇīyan'ti vadāmi.

example_1: suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu, mogharāja sadā sato, att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca, evaṃ maccutaro siyā, evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ, maccurājā na passatī'ti.
example_2: diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno, samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā, ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ, tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.
example_3: aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ, dukkham'addakkhu dukkhato. anattani anattā'ti, asubhaṃ asubhat'addasuṃ. sammādiṭṭhisamādānā, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun'ti
example_4: āpaṃ āpato sañjānāti, āpaṃ āpato saññatvā āpaṃ maññati, āpasmiṃ maññati, āpato maññati, āpaṃ me'ti maññati, āpaṃ abhinandati.

meaning: considers as; takes as; regards as
example_1: yen'eva bālo'ti paraṃ dahāti, ten'ātumānaṃ kusalo'ti c'āha, sayam'attanā so kusalo vadāno, aññaṃ vimāneti tadeva pāva.
example_2: diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno, samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā, ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ, tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

meaning: among doctrines grasped after evaluation; in ideas adopted after consideration
example_1: yass'ūbhay'ante paṇidh'īdha n'atthi, bhavābhavāya idha vā huraṃ vā, nivesanā tassa na santi keci, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ.
example_2: diṭṭhīnivesā na hi svātivattā, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, tasmā naro tesu nivesanesu, nirassatī ādiyatī ca dhammaṃ.
example_3: idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.

meaning: ruler of men; lord of men; king; chief
example_1: etādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi, nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ, diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ, bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

meaning: noble person; great man; epithet of an arahant; epithet of the Buddha
example_1: api ca, udāyi, yo sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya āguṃ na karoti kāyena vācāya manasā, tam'ahaṃ nāgo'ti brūmī'ti.
example_2: okañ'jahaṃ taṇhacchidaṃ anejaṃ, nandiñ'jahaṃ oghatiṇṇaṃ vimuttaṃ, kappañ'jahaṃ abhiyāce sumedhaṃ, sutvāna nāgassa apanamissanti ito.
example_3: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

meaning: has not seen; did not see
example_1: taṃ ce hi n'āddakkhuṃ tathāvimuttaṃ, (icc'āyasmā mogharājā) devā manussā idha vā huraṃ vā, nar'uttamaṃ atthacaraṃ narānaṃ, ye taṃ namassanti pasaṃsiyā te'ti.
example_2: diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno, samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā, ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ, tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

meaning: was not; did not exist; did not become
example_1: purimā, bhikkhave, koṭi na paññāyati avijjāya, ito pubbe avijjā n'āhosi, atha pacchā samabhavī'ti. evañ'c'etaṃ, bhikkhave, vuccati, atha ca pana paññāyati, idappaccayā avijjā'ti
example_2: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

meaning: evaluating; ascertaining; discriminating; distinguishing the difference (between)
example_1: idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.
example_2: na tena hoti dhammaṭṭho, yen'atthaṃ sāhasā naye, yo ca atthaṃ anatthañ'ca, ubho niccheyya paṇḍito.

example_1: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.
atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n'eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam'eva alattha
example_2: alaṃ, bhaṇe jīvaka, tuyham'eva hotu. amhākaññ'eva antepure nivesanaṃ māpehī'ti.
example_3: na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.
example_4: evañ'ca vadeti, sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā ānando yena sirivaḍḍhassa gahapatissa nivesanaṃ ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti.

example_1: yadattanī passati ānisaṃsaṃ, diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā, tadeva so tattha samuggahāya, nihīnato passati sabbamaññaṃ.
example_2: samo visesī uda vā nihīno, yo maññatī so vivadetha tena, tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno, samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.
example_3: abhūtavādī nirayaṃ upeti, yo vā'pi katvā na karomi c'āha, ubho'pi te pecca samā bhavanti, nihīnakammā manujā parattha.

meaning: could be led astray (by); could be misguided (by)
example_1: na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.
example_2: na kappayanti na purekkharonti, dhammā'pi tesaṃ na paṭicchitāse, na brāhmaṇo sīlavatena neyyo, pāraṅ'gato na pacceti tādī'ti.

example_1: no ce kira diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, maññām'ahaṃ momuham'eva dhammaṃ, diṭṭhiyā eke paccenti suddhiṃ.
example_2: no ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro, iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū'ti, iti'ssa bhavanti vattāro

example_1: sabbattha munī anissito, na piyaṃ kubbati no'pi appiyaṃ, tasmiṃ paridevamaccharaṃ, paṇṇe vāri yathā na limpati.
example_2: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.
example_3: na saññasaññī na visaññasaññī, no'pi asaññī na vibhūtasaññī. evaṃ sametassa vibhoti rūpaṃ, saññānidānā hi papañcasaṅkhā.

meaning: (of an idea or opinion) imagined; fabricated; fashioned; designed; devised; concocted
example_1: tass'īdha diṭṭhe va sute mute vā, pakappitā n'atthi aṇū'pi saññā, taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ diṭṭhim'anādiyānaṃ, ken'īdha lokasmiṃ vikappayeyya.
example_2: nivissavādī na hi subbināyo, pakappitaṃ diṭṭhi purekkharāno, yaṃ nissito tattha subhaṃ vadāno, suddhiṃvado tattha tath'addasā so.
example_3: pakappitā saṅkhatā yassa dhammā, purakkhatā santi avīvadātā, yadattani passati ānisaṃsaṃ, taṃ nissito kuppapaṭicca santiṃ.
example_4: vinicchayā yāni pakappitāni, te ve munī brūsi anuggahāya, ajjhattasantī'ti yam'etam'atthaṃ, kathaṃ nu dhīrehi paveditaṃ taṃ.

example_1: appamādaratā hotha, sacittam'anurakkhatha, duggā uddharath'attānaṃ, paṅke sanno'va kuñjaro.
example_2: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.
example_3: evam'etaṃ mahāvīra, yathā samaṇa bhāsasi. ettha c'eke visīdanti, paṅkamhi'va jaraggavo.
example_4: ehi me tvaṃ, bhikkhu, paṅke saṅkamo hohī'ti

example_1: idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.

meaning: believes (to be); assumes (to be); takes as
example_1: jānāmi passāmi tath'eva etaṃ, diṭṭhiyā eke paccenti suddhiṃ, addakkhi ce kiñ'hi tumassa tena, atisitvā aññena vadanti suddhiṃ.
example_2: kiṃ nu satto'ti paccesi, māra diṭṭhigataṃ nu te, suddhasaṅkhārapuñjo'yaṃ, na'y'idha satt'upalabbhati.

meaning: liberated by understanding; emancipated by insight
example_1: bhikkhu'pi, bhikkhave, paññāvimutto rūpassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimutto paññāvimutto'ti vuccati.
example_2: paññāvimutto, idha ekacco puggalo ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te na kāyena phusitvā viharati, paññāya c'assa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
example_3: saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā, paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā, saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ, te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.

meaning: (of an argument) would start; would begin; would engage (in)
example_1: saccan'ti so brāhmaṇo kiṃ vadeyya, musā'ti vā so vivadetha kena, yasmiṃ samaṃ visamaṃ vā'pi n'atthi, sa kena vādaṃ paṭisaṃyujeyya.
icchitaṃ patthitaṃ ... khippam'eva samijjhatu, sabbe pūrentu saṅkappā, cando paṇṇaraso yathā, maṇi jotiraso yathā
example_2: etādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi, nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ, diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ, bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

example_1: avijjā'ti ... asaṃgāhanā apariyogāhanā asamapekkhanā apaccavekkhaṇā apaccavekkhaṇakammaṃ dummejjhaṃ bālyaṃ asampajaññaṃ moho pamoho sammoho
example_2: diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno, samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā, ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ, tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

example_1: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.
example_2: catucakkaṃ navadvāraṃ, puṇṇaṃ lobhena saṃyutaṃ, paṅkajātaṃ mahāvīra, kathaṃ yātrā bhavissatī'ti.
example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, aṅgārakāsu sādhikaporisā puṇṇā aṅgārānaṃ vīt'accikānaṃ vītadhūmānaṃ.
example_4: atha kho so bhikkhu vihāraṃ pavisissāmī'ti kavāṭaṃ paṇāmento addasa sabbaṃ vihāraṃ ahinā puṇṇaṃ, vātapānehi bhoge nikkhante, disvāna bhīto vissaram'akāsi.

meaning: you say; you tell; you call
example_1: vinicchayā yāni pakappitāni, te ve munī brūsi anuggahāya, ajjhattasantī'ti yam'etam'atthaṃ, kathaṃ nu dhīrehi paveditaṃ taṃ.
example_2: mātaraṃ kuṭikaṃ brūsi, bhariyaṃ brūsi kulāvakaṃ, putte santānake brūsi, taṇhaṃ me brūsi bandhanan'ti.

example_1: etādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi, nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ, diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ, bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.
na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.
atthi imasmiṃ kāye … antaṃ antaguṇaṃ udariyaṃ karīsaṃ, pittaṃ semhaṃ pubbo lohitaṃ sedo medo, assu vasā kheḷo siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttaṃ
example_2: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.
example_3: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?
example_4: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, pittaṃ semhaṃ pubbo lohitaṃ sedo medo, assu vasā kheḷo siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttaṃ … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.

meaning: monk; sage; seer; hermit; silent sage
example_1: pāpāni parivajjeti, sa munī tena so muni, yo munāti ubho loke, muni tena pavuccati.
example_2: accī yathā vātavegena khittā, atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ, evaṃ munī nāmakāyā vimutto, atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ.
example_3: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

example_1: saccan'ti so brāhmaṇo kiṃ vadeyya, musā'ti vā so vivadetha kena, yasmiṃ samaṃ visamaṃ vā'pi n'atthi, sa kena vādaṃ paṭisaṃyujeyya.
abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārī hoti ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.
example_2: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.
example_3: pāṇaṃ na haññe na c'adinnam'ādiye, musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā, abrahmacariyā virameyya methunā, rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojanaṃ.
example_4: eko pubbe caritvāna, methunaṃ yo nisevati, yānaṃ bhantaṃ va taṃ loke, hīnam'āhu puthujjanaṃ.

meaning: very foolish; completely confused; totally deluded; entirely stupid
example_1: no ce kira diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, maññām'ahaṃ momuham'eva dhammaṃ, diṭṭhiyā eke paccenti suddhiṃ.
example_2: jiṇṇo'ham'asmi abalo vītavaṇṇo, nettā na suddhā savanaṃ na phāsu, m'āhaṃ nassaṃ momuho antarāva, ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ, jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

meaning: as very foolish; as completely confused; as totally deluded; as entirely stupid
example_1: diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno, samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā, ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ, tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

meaning: whatever this means; concerning this matter
example_1: vinicchayā yāni pakappitāni, te ve munī brūsi anuggahāya, ajjhattasantī'ti yam'etam'atthaṃ, kathaṃ nu dhīrehi paveditaṃ taṃ.
example_2: sātaṃ asātañ'ca kutonidānā, kismiṃ asante na bhavanti h'ete, vibhavaṃ bhavañ'c'āpi yam'etam'atthaṃ, etaṃ me pabrūhi yatonidānaṃ.

example_1: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

meaning: name of one of the three daughters of Death
example_1: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.
example_2: atha kho taṇhā ca arati ca ragā ca māradhītaro yena māro pāpimā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu.

example_1: etādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi, nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ, diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ, bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.
example_2: yo pana bhikkhu rañño khattiyassa muddh'ābhisittassa anikkhantarājake aniggataratanake pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning: name; label; concept; idea; notion; impression; representation; symbol
example_1: na paro paraṃ nikubbetha, n'ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kiñci byārosanā, paṭighasaññā, n'āññam'aññassa dukkham'iccheyya.
example_2: rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappeyyāsi pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasikaritvā
example_3: tass'īdha diṭṭhe va sute mute vā, pakappitā n'atthi aṇū'pi saññā, taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ diṭṭhim'anādiyānaṃ, ken'īdha lokasmiṃ vikappayeyya.
example_4: diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno, samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā, ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ, tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

meaning: detached from perception; indifferent to concepts
example_1: saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā, paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā, saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ, te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.
uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha, daḷhaṃ sikkhatha santiyā, mā vo pamatte viññāya, maccurājā amohayittha vas'ānuge.
example_2: etañ'ca dhammam'aññāya, vicinaṃ bhikkhu sadā sato sikkhe, santī'ti nibbutiṃ ñatvā, sāsane gotamassa na pamajjeyya.
example_3: idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.
example_4: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

meaning: promoting a doctrine of peace; professing peace
example_1: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

meaning: to touch; to bring into contact (with)
example_1: disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca, n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ, kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ, pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

meaning: precepts and practices; ethics and observances; rites and rituals
example_1: sahā'v'assa dassanasampadāya, taya'ssu dhammā jahitā bhavanti. sakkāyadiṭṭhi vicikicchitañ'ca, sīlabbataṃ vā pi yadatthi kiñci.
example_2: ye kec'ime samaṇabrāhmaṇāse, diṭṭhassutenāpi vadanti suddhiṃ, sīlabbaten'āpi vadanti suddhiṃ, anekarūpena vadanti suddhiṃ, kacci'ssu te bhagavā tattha yatā carantā, atāru jātiñ'ca jarañ'ca mārisa, pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.
example_3: mosavajje na nīyetha, sampajāno saṭhāni na kayirā, atha jīvitena paññāya, sīlabbatena n'āññam'atimaññe.
example_4: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbatena-api na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

example_1: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha, adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena, ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

example_2: vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke, atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti, vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti, tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.

example_1: kiñ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ vadetha? ruppatī'ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā rūpan'ti vuccati
example_2: akittayī vivaṭacakkhu, sakkhidhammaṃ parissayavinayaṃ, paṭipadaṃ vadehi bhaddante, pātimokkhaṃ athavā'pi samādhiṃ.
example_3: evañ'ca vadeti, sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā ānando yena sirivaḍḍhassa gahapatissa nivesanaṃ ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti.
example_4: etādisaṃ ce ratanaṃ na icchasi, nāriṃ nar'indehi bahūhi patthitaṃ, diṭṭhigataṃ sīlavataṃ nu jīvitaṃ, bhav'ūpapattiñ'ca vadesi kīdisaṃ.

example_1: saccaṃ vihāya matisaccakavādaketuṃ, vād'ābhiropitamanaṃ atiandhabhūtaṃ, paññāpadīpajalito jitavā mun'indo
example_2: vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke, atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti, vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti, tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.
example_3: na'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhan'atthaṃ, na janalapan'atthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilok'ānisaṃs'atthaṃ, na itivādappamokkh'ānisaṃs'atthaṃ, na iti maṃ jano jānātū'ti
example_4: saccan'ti so brāhmaṇo kiṃ vadeyya, musā'ti vā so vivadetha kena, yasmiṃ samaṃ visamaṃ vā'pi n'atthi, sa kena vādaṃ paṭisaṃyujeyya.

example_1: kām'upādānaṃ, diṭṭh'upādānaṃ, sīlabbat'upādānaṃ, attavād'upādānaṃ. idaṃ vuccati taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ.
example_2: te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharonti, imaṃ mayaṃ pañhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma. evaṃ ce no puṭṭho evaṃ byākarissati, evam'assa mayaṃ vādaṃ āropessāma.
example_3: santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kesamuttaṃ āgacchanti. te sakaṃ'y'eva vādaṃ dīpenti jotenti, parappavādaṃ pana khuṃsenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhiṃ karonti.
example_4: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

example_1: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.
example_2: na harāmi na bhañjāmi, ārā siṅghāmi vārijaṃ, atha kena nu vaṇṇena, gandhattheno'ti vuccati.

example_1: saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā, paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā, saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ, te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.
example_2: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

example_1: dukkhe anattasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato imasmiñ'ca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'āpagataṃ mānasaṃ hoti vidhāsamatikkantaṃ santaṃ suvimuttaṃ.
example_2: samo visesī uda vā nihīno, yo maññatī so vivadetha tena, tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno, samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.

example_1: vinicchayā yāni pakappitāni, te ve munī brūsi anuggahāya, ajjhattasantī'ti yam'etam'atthaṃ, kathaṃ nu dhīrehi paveditaṃ taṃ.
example_2: sukhavinicchayaṃ jaññā, sukhavinicchayaṃ ñatvā ajjhattaṃ sukham'anuyuñjeyya.
example_3: asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho, ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha, saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca, samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca

meaning: detached (from); without desire (for); become indifferent (to); lost interest (in)
example_1: khīṇaṃ purāṇaṃ navaṃ n'atthi sambhavaṃ, virattacitt'āyatike bhavasmiṃ. te khīṇabījā avirūḷhichandā, nibbanti dhīrā yath'āyaṃ padīpo.
example_2: saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā, paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā, saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ, te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.

example_1: saccan'ti so brāhmaṇo kiṃ vadeyya, musā'ti vā so vivadetha kena, yasmiṃ samaṃ visamaṃ vā'pi n'atthi, sa kena vādaṃ paṭisaṃyujeyya.
samo visesī uda vā nihīno, yo maññatī so vivadetha tena, tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno, samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.
example_2: diṭṭhim'pi lokasmiṃ na kappayeyya, ñāṇena vā sīlavatena vā'pi, samo'ti attānam'anūpaneyya, hīno na maññetha visesi vā'pi.

example_1: n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, lokena vivadāmi, loko'va mayā vivadati. na, bhikkhave, dhammavādī kenaci lokasmiṃ vivadati.
example_2: evaṃ vimuttacitto kho, aggivessana, bhikkhu na kenaci saṃvadati, na kenaci vivadati, yañ'ca loke vuttaṃ tena voharati, aparāmasan'ti.
example_3: samo visesī uda vā nihīno, yo maññatī so vivadetha tena, tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno, samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.
example_4: ekañ'hi saccaṃ na dutīyam'atthi, yasmiṃ pajā no vivade pajānaṃ, nānā te saccāni sayaṃ thunanti, tasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.

example_1: bhikkhu vivittaṃ sen'āsanaṃ bhajati
example_2: patilīnacarassa bhikkhuno, bhajamānassa vivittam'āsanaṃ, sāmaggiyam'āhu tassa taṃ, yo attānaṃ bhavane na dassaye.
example_3: na sīlabbatamattena, bāhusaccena vā pana. atha vā samādhilābhena, vivittasayanena vā.
example_4: yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo, jalambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ, evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.

example_1: na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.
example_2: vedāni viceyya kevalāni, samaṇānaṃ yān'idh'atthi brāhmaṇānaṃ, sabbavedanāsu vītarāgo, sabbaṃ vedam'aticca vedagū so.

meaning: who has perfect knowledge; who has complete understanding
example_1: sukhino vata ye akiñcanā, vedaguno hi janā akiñcanā, sakiñcanaṃ passa vihaññamānaṃ, jano janasmiṃ paṭibandhacitto.
example_2: pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ, maññāmi taṃ vedaguṃ bhāvit'attaṃ, kuto nu dukkhā samudāgatā ime, ye keci lokasmim'anekarūpā.
example_3: kathañ'ca bhikkhu vedagū hoti? vidit'āssa honti pāpakā akusalā dhammā, saṃkilesikā, ponobbhavikā, sadarā, dukkhavipākā, āyatiṃ, jātijarāmaraṇiyā
example_4: na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā, sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so, na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo, anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.

example_1: idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ, passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhattasantiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.
example_2: akkheyyañ'ca pariññāya, akkhātāraṃ na maññati, tañ'hi tassa na hotī'ti, yena naṃ vajjā na tassa atthi.

example_1: samo visesī uda vā nihīno, yo maññatī so vivadetha tena, tīsu vidhāsu avikampamāno, samo visesī'ti na tassa hoti.
